content: Career Credit Card Asked by AnonymousAsked on 15 Jan 2019I applied for DBS multiplier the moment I signed a contract for a full-time job, but I just got asked to leave my job. How?My DBS multiplier card is actually the least of my worries right now but really don't know how to proceed from here since I won't have a monthly input to maintain the card. Any advice?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardAnswered on 20 Mar 2019Are there account closure fees? If no, then perhaps you could switch to an account that does not require monthly salary creditting, like the Citibank Maxigain savings account!0 comments0

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 16 Jan 2019If application success, just use the account normally? I think you just dont get the bonus interest. But you have to maintain average daily balance of $3000 if you are older than 29 years old.0 comments0
